TEXT_CUSTOMIZE_INTRO_1: You've come to the right place if you want to make FastComments look like your own.
TEXT_CUSTOMIZE_INTRO_2: These settings will affect how FastComments looks on your site. You can define these customizations as "rules" - a rule can apply to a whole domain or a single page.
HEADING_WHAT_SITE_TO_CUSTOMIZE: What site do you want to customize?
TEXT_DOMAIN_NOTE: This is optional. Select All Domains and the rules will apply to all sites. Don't see your site listed? Add it here.
TEXT_URL_ID_NOTE_1: This is optional. Leave it blank or enter * and the rules will apply to all pages.
TEXT_URL_ID_NOTE_2: Patterns are also supported! For example you could have */blog/* in one configuration and */store/* in another.
OPTION_AUTOMATIC: Automatic (detect light or dark site background)
TEXT_AUTOMATIC_NOTE: Automatic styling will detect your site's color scheme and attempt to match it. If the site is dark, we'll enable dark mode, for example.
TEXT_FORCE_DARK_NOTE: Force Dark Mode will mean your site must have a dark background, otherwise text may be unreadable.
TEXT_FORCE_WRAPPED_NOTE: Force Wrapped will put the comment widget in a container with a white background to isolate it from your site.
TEXT_NEVER_WRAP_NOTE: Never Wrap is like Auto but only Dark Mode. We'll never put the widget in a container with its own background.
TEXT_COMMENT_COUNT_FORMAT_NOTE: Use [count] to represent the localized comment count.
TEXT_HIDE_AVATARS_NOTE: Even if someone has an avatar, it won't show next to their name.
TEXT_GIF_RATING_NOTE: When image uploads are allowed, this controls the rating of gifs shown in the Gif Picker.
TEXT_IMAGE_PROFANITY_NOTE: Controls the level of profanity moderation for uploaded images.
TEXT_PROFANITY_LOW: Low: Blocks explicit sexual and violence content
TEXT_PROFANITY_MEDIUM: Medium: Also blocks hate, harassment and self-harm content
TEXT_DISABLE_BLOCKING_NOTE: Do not allow users to block other users. Does not affect existing blocked users.
LABEL_INPUT_AFTER_COMMENTS: Move reply box to the bottom of the page?
TEXT_INPUT_AFTER_COMMENTS_NOTE: Want people to read the comments before replying?
TEXT_CLICK_TO_SHOW_COMMENTS_NOTE: Hide the comment list and the comment box under a link?
TEXT_USE_SHOW_COMMENTS_TOGGLE_NOTE: Click to show comments, with the ability to show a number of comments by default. Shows the comment box by default.
TEXT_COUNT_ABOVE_TOGGLE_NOTE: How many comments should we show above the "Show Comments" button?
TEXT_PREVENT_NEW_REPLIES_NOTE: Enabling this will disable commenting, but show previous comments, for the defined site/url.
TEXT_PREVENT_NEW_ROOT_COMMENTS_NOTE: Enabling this will disable creating new top-level comments, but allow replying to existing comments.
TEXT_COLLAPSE_LIVE_COMMENTS_NOTE: Enabling this will collapse "live" comments under a "Show X New Comments" button. Otherwise, new live comments will show normally as they are added.
TEXT_DISABLE_LIVE_COMMENTING_NOTE: Enabling this will turn off all live features. Clients will not show live updates to the comment feed, votes, comment changes (edits, deletes), and result of moderation actions.
LABEL_REQUIRE_SSO: Require SSO To View Comments
TEXT_REQUIRE_SSO_NOTE: Enabling this will require commenters to be logged in via SSO (single-sign-on) to view the comment widget. Does not apply to the site admin.
TEXT_SSO_SECURITY_LEVEL_NOTE: Choose Simple SSO for third party integrations, Secure SSO for custom server-based integrations.
LABEL_LIMIT_COMMENTS_BY_GROUPS: Limit Comments by SSO User Groups
TEXT_LIMIT_COMMENTS_BY_GROUPS_NOTE: With this enabled, users will only see comments from their same access groups.
TEXT_ENABLE_COMMENTER_LINKS_NOTE: Enabling this will show a field for entering a website or blog URL when commenting. The commenter's username then links to this URL.
TEXT_SINGLE_LINE_COMMENT_INPUT_NOTE: Enabling this will change the multi-line comment input field into a single-row input.
LABEL_COLLAPSE_REPLIES: Collapse Replies to Top-Level Comments by Default
TEXT_COLLAPSE_REPLIES_NOTE: Enabling this will require users to click "Show Replies" to see child comments.
TEXT_ENABLE_WYSIWYG_NOTE: Enables WYSIWYG editing which allows formatting text without using visible anchor tags.
TEXT_ENABLE_RESIZE_HANDLE_NOTE: Allows users to resize comment input areas by dragging the corner.
TEXT_ENABLE_SPOILERS_NOTE: Adds a "SPOILER" button to the editor toolbar.
TEXT_DISABLE_TOOLBAR_NOTE: The comment reply toolbar, commonly called a WYSIWYG toolbar, will not show. Users will not be able to make text bold, for example, or upload images.
TEXT_DISABLE_VOTING_NOTE: Users will not be able to vote, and existing vote counts will be hidden.
TEXT_VOTE_STYLE_NOTE: When the heart icon is enabled, down voting is not possible and also validated server-side.
TEXT_ENABLE_VOTE_LIST_NOTE: Show users' names when hovering over comment vote counts.
TEXT_DISABLE_COMMENTER_COMMENT_DELETE_NO: Commenters will not be able to delete their comments.
TEXT_DISABLE_COMMENTER_COMMENT_EDIT_NOTE: Commenters will not be able to edit their comments.
TEXT_DISABLE_AUTO_HASHTAG_CREATION_NOTE: New hash tags will not be automatically bolded. A list of hash tags will have to be provided instead, to enable hash tags. The list of tags can also be maintained via the API.
TEXT_DISABLE_NOTIFICATION_BELL_NOTE: The notification bell tells users when someone has replied to them, or replied in a thread they are active in, and more. It can also be used to subscribe to a page.
TEXT_DISABLE_PROFILES_NOTE: Disables opening the user's profile when you click on their avatar.
TEXT_SHOW_BADGES_IN_TOP_BAR_NOTE: Shows user badges next to their username in the comment reply top bar.
TEXT_DEFAULT_SORT_DIRECTION_NOTE: This will set the default sort direction of the comments. Users can still change it after the comments load.
TEXT_LOCALE_OVERRIDE_NOTE: This will set the locale for the comment widget, no matter what the user's browser is set to.
TEXT_PAGE_SIZE_NOTE: This will set the number of comments per-page. Upon changing, it may take several minutes to update all comment threads.
OPTION_NAME_FORMAT_CAPITALIZE: Capitalize (display example user as Example User)
OPTION_NAME_FORMAT_LAST_INITIAL: Last Initial (display Example User as Example U.)
OPTION_NAME_FORMAT_ALL_INITIALS: All Initials (display Example User as E. U.)
TEXT_COMMENTER_NAME_FORMAT_NOTE: Names are masked server-side to protect users.
TEXT_COMMENT_THREAD_DELETION_MODE_NOTE: What should the behavior be when deleting a comment that has replies?
TEXT_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_COOKIE_BYPASS_NO: This will cause a popup to be opened to fetch their fastcomments.com cookie when they comment, as a workaround for strict browser settings that block third-party cookies.
TEXT_ENABLE_VIEW_COUNTS_NOTE: Enables a live updating count next to each comment that increments when a user views a comment. Comment view counts are only tracked once this is enabled.
TEXT_DISABLE_AUTO_ADMIN_MIGRATION_NOTE: Disables automatic admin sync for SSO. Useful for WordPress sites where SSO is enabled and you don't want your WP admins to become FastComment admins or moderators.
TEXT_DISABLE_SUCCESS_MESSAGE_NOTE: Disables message that shows after submitting a comment.
TEXT_SHOW_QUESTION_NOTE: Read more about collecting feedback here
OPTION_WHEN_SAVE_ON_ANSWER: On Answer (don't wait for full review)
TEXT_WIDGET_QUESTION_RESULTS_STYLE_NOTE: How to show each user's ratings, if at all.
TEXT_WIDGET_QUESTION_NOTE: Create a question to show via Customize -> Questions. Sub-questions will be shown as well if they are configured as part of the selected question.
TEXT_RESTRICT_EXTERNAL_LINKS_NOTE: Restrict users to only linking to these sites.
TEXT_ALLOWED_SITES_NOTE: Enter comma separated list of domains, or sites, that users can link to.
TEXT_ALLOWED_LANGUAGES_NOTE: Comments will only be allowed to be posted in these languages.
TEXT_MAX_COMMENT_SIZE_NOTE: This will limit how long of a comment can be written, excluding image URLs.
TEXT_MAX_COMMENTS_PER_MINUTE_NOTE: How many comments can non-admin users create per minute?
TEXT_DEFAULT_AVATAR_NOTE: The image that shows when a user doesn't have an avatar defined.
TEXT_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_COMMENTS_NOTE: Anonymous comments will always show as unverified.
TEXT_PREVENT_REMOVAL_NOTE: To prevent them from being removed configure your Moderation Settings here.
TEXT_HIDE_EMAIL_INPUTS_NOTE: Users will never have to enter their email to comment or vote.
TEXT_DEFAULT_USERNAME_NOTE: The default value of the username input field.
TEXT_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_VOTES_NOTE: Votes will be able to be left without being logged in, or providing a username and email.
TEXT_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_FLAGGING_NOTE: Users will be able to flag comments without being logged in.
TEXT_HIDE_UNVERIFIED_COMMENT_LABEL_NOTE: Read more about comment verification here
TEXT_USE_ABSOLUTE_DATES_NOTE: This will show dates like "<%= new Date().toLocaleString() %>" instead of "just now".
LABEL_USE_BOTH_RELATIVE_AND_ABSOLUTE: Use both relative and absolute dates?
TEXT_USE_BOTH_RELATIVE_AND_ABSOLUTE_NOTE: This will show dates like "just now (<%= new Date().toLocaleDateString() %>)" instead of "just now".
TEXT_COMMENT_HTML_RENDERING_MODE_NOTE: Comments are rendered into HTML, and a small safe subset of HTML is supported. We do things like strip too many newlines, large headings, and scripts. You may also choose to render links in raw text instead of an HTML link element to deter spammers.
TEXT_SPAM_RULES_NOTE: Define custom rules to automatically flag content as spam or not spam based on text matching.
LABEL_ENABLE_TOS: Require Terms of Service acceptance for first-time commenters
TEXT_ENABLE_TOS_NOTE: When enabled, new commenters must accept your Terms of Service before submitting their first comment.
PLACEHOLDER_TOS_TEXT: I agree to the Terms of Service
TEXT_TOS_CUSTOM_TEXT_NOTE: Leave empty to use the default text for this locale.
TEXT_TOS_LAST_UPDATED_NOTE: When set, users who accepted before this date will need to accept again.
